meanings.definition: Designed or constructed with excessive complexity or unnecessary features.
meanings.sent1: The overengineered machine had so many buttons that no one knew how to use it.
meanings.sent2: The overengineered software was slow and confusing to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The overengineered toaster had a hundred settings, but all anyone wanted was a simple 'on' button.
meanings.sent4: Her overengineered plan for the party ended up causing more stress than joy.
meanings.sent5: The overengineered bridge collapsed under its own weight due to too many unnecessary supports.

meanings.definition: To design or construct something with more complexity or features than necessary.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overengineer his presentations with too many slides and animations.
meanings.sent2: The team decided not to overengineer the project and focused on simplicity instead.
meanings.sent3: She overengineered the cake by adding too many layers, making it unstable.
meanings.sent4: Trying to overengineer every aspect of life can lead to unnecessary stress and complications.
meanings.sent5: The company chose to overengineer the product, resulting in higher costs and longer development time.
